msDesc.head: Wigbod and Bede, commentaries on the first eight books of the Bible; Lorsch Abbey, 2nd quarter of the 9th century

msItem.author: Wigbod (?)
msItem.title: Explanatio sex dierum
msItem.incipit: In principio creauit deus caelum et terram. Istud capitulum omnium librorum capud est
msItem.explicit: in aeternum cum ipso et sanctis suis sine defectu gaudere mereamur amen.

msItem.rubric: Exameron Bedae. Dilectissimo ac reuerentissimo antistiti acca humillimus famulorum cristi baeda salutem.
msItem.incipit: De principio libri genesis⹎ in quo mundi huius creatio descripta est⹎ multi multa dixere
msItem.explicit: deo fauente redidero; bene uale semper amantissimæ antistes nostri memor in domino.

msItem.incipit: In principio creauit deus caelum et terram. creationem mundi insinuans scriptura diuina. apte primo statim uerbo aeternitatem⹎
msItem.explicit: nulla rerum uicissitudine a contemplando dei uultu transmutabitur.

msItem.author: Wigbod
msItem.title: Commentarium in Octateuchum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber questionum super genesis ex dictis sanctorum patrum agustini· gregorii· hieronimi· ambrosii· hilarii· hisidori· eucherii· et iunilli·

msItem.title: In Genesin
msItem.incipit: Δ. Primo omnium preceptor mi⹎ inquiri mihi necesse est, quis huius libri qui Genesis apud nos dicitur scribtor habeatur. M. Sicut a maioribus
msItem.explicit: Dicente domino. Erit in nouissimis diebus effundande spiritu meo super omnem carnem.

msItem.title: In Exodum
msItem.incipit: Quaedam mysteria ex libro geneseos et obscuriora rerum gestarum
msItem.explicit: et exoret pro omnibus in se credentibus.

msItem.title: In Leuiticum
msItem.explicit: repudiantur hostiae a domino. et reicitur huius sacrificium ab ecclesia catholica.

msItem.title: In Numeros
msItem.rubric: (fol. 116r) Incipit explanatio libri numeri et catalogus mansionum
msItem.incipit: Δ. Prima nobis quaestio oritur. cur hic liber numeri nomen acceperit?

msItem.title: In Deuteronomium
msItem.incipit: Δ. Deuteronomium iuxta fidem hystoriae quae describit.
msItem.explicit: Si enim hic pro peccatis cedimur. illic sine peccato inuenimur.

msItem.title: In Iesum Naue
msItem.incipit: (fol. 127v) Post mortem ergo moysi loquitur dominus
msItem.explicit: et in parius sibi resistentibus discit quod ex se maiora non subigit.

msItem.title: In Iudices
msItem.incipit: Historia iudicum non parua musteriorum indicat sacramenta
msItem.explicit: et reparato certamine in finem fortissime a demonibus triumphabit.

msItem.title: In Ruth
msItem.incipit: Videamus nunc et ruth. habet enim ista typum ecclesiae
msItem.explicit: quae adimpleuit is qui pollicitus est per filium suum iesum cristum regem et saluatorem nostrum. cum quo est illi honor et gloria in saecula saeculorum. Amen.

msItem.note: Various biblical quotations written as pen trials.

supportDesc.collation: Mostly in quaternions. First leaf (with title page) lost; one quire lost after after fol. 39. Quires signed on the final page: I (fol. 7v), Q II (15v), III (fol. 23v), Q IIII–V (fol. 31v, fol. 39v), VII–VIII (fols. 47v, 55v, 63v).

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint. 2 columns of 36 lines, ruled space 260 210

handDesc.handNote: Carolingian minuscule, written by multiple hands; Bischoff designates it Jüngerer Lorscher Stil.

decoDesc.decoNote: Incipits, explicits and subheadings in Capitalis rustica and, more rarely, in uncial (partly in red): fol. 1ra, line 1 in capitalis rustica and line 2 in uncial.

Initial capitals (enlarged at the beginning of text or sections), sentence capitals; chapter count; quotation marks; Change of speaker between Discipulus (Δ) and Magister (M) recorded to the left of the text columns

binding.p: Standard Laudian binding, brown tanned calf over laminated pulpboard. Rebacked.

history.origin: Written at Lorsch Abbey in the 9th century, 2nd quarter according to Bischoff, Katalog der festländischen Handschriften des neunten Jahrhunderts (Wiesbaden, 2004), no. 3848. Inscribed, Codex de monasterio sancti Nazarii (fol. 135v). Probably there during the Cistercian interlude in Lorsch, 1232/34–ca. 1245.
history.provenance: Eberbach, Cistercian Abbey of the Virgin Mary of the Virgin Mary. Listed in the Eberbach catalog of 1502 under the signature F 13: F 13 Collecta super libros moysi Iudicum. et Ruth Initium In principio creauit deus celum (edited in Palmer 1998, p. 237).

The Eberbach library was plundered several times during the Thirty Years' War 1631-1635 and numerous manuscripts subsequently came into the possession of William Laud. Inscribed, Liber Guilielmi Laud Archiepiscopi Cant: et Cancellar: Uniuersit: Oxon. 1638 (fol. 1r).
history.acquisition: Given to the Bodleian Library as part of Laud’s third donation in 1639.

recordHist.source: Description expanded by Andrew Dunning (July 2022) from Michael Kautz, Bibliotheca Laureshamensis (2014). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Laudian Manuscripts, Quarto Catalogues II, repr. with corrections, 1969, from the original ed. of 1858–1885). Quarto Catalogue, col. 148 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 1, p. 49

revisionDesc.change: Andrew Dunning Revised with consultation of original.
James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
